choices.E: the Skype for Business admin center
choices.B: the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) PowerShell for Graph module

choices.D: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the global teams policy.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams.

You need to identify the following:

• The number of guest users on a team named Customer Support.
• Users that use the Teams mobile app for iOS.

Which reports should you run? To answer, drag the appropriate reports to the correct requirements. Each report may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

You have a Microsoft Office 365 subscription that contains a user named User1.

You need to ensure that User1 can view Usage reports in the Microsoft Teams admin center. The solution must use the principle of least privilege.

Which role should you assign to User1?

discussion.content: tested the answer is C. Global Reader

Selected Answer: C
According https://learn.microsoft.com/en-gb/microsoftteams/teams-analytics-and-reports/teams-reporting-reference#how-to-access-the-reports

Selected Answer: A
Ans : A

To allow User1 to view usage reports in the Microsoft Teams admin center while following the principle of least privilege, the Usage Summary Reports Reader role is the most appropriate. This role provides access to view usage reports across Microsoft 365, including Teams, without granting additional administrative permissions.

Global Reader:
While the Global Reader role can view all administrative features across Microsoft 365, it grants broader read-only access than necessary, violating the principle of least privileg

Selected Answer: A
Please compare Global Reader and Usage Summary Reports Reader in the admin portal. And portal shows that Usage Summary Reports Reader has fewer privileges.

Selected Answer: C
How to access the reports
To access the reports, you must be assigned one of the following roles:

Global administrator.
Teams or Skype for Business administrator.
Global reader (only tenant-level aggregate and no per-user or team data).

Selected Answer: C
Navigated to Usage Reports in TAC and clicked "Learn more" at the top. It brought me to the article which is saying next:

How to access the reports

To access the reports, you must be assigned one of the following roles:

 Global administrator.
 Teams or Skype for Business administrator.
 Global reader (only tenant-level aggregate and no per-user or team data).

So I assume the answer is C. Global Reader 

Link: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-US/microsoftteams/teams-analytics-and-reports/teams-reporting-reference?WT.mc_id=TeamsAdminCenterCSH

Selected Answer: A
Usage Summary Reports Reader: This role grants access to aggregated, tenant-level Teams usage data. This means User1 can see overall trends and usage statistics but cannot access individual user or team data. This aligns with the principle of least privilege by providing the minimum necessary access to fulfill User1's task of viewing usage reports. Global Reader grants read-only access to almost all aspects of Microsoft 365, including user information, licenses, and security settings. It's far too much access for simply viewing Teams usage reports.

Selected Answer: C

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-gb/microsoftteams/teams-analytics-and-reports/teams-reporting-reference#how-to-access-the-reports

So, I think the correct answer is Global Reader.
least privilege is the key word

Global reader (with no user details)
Usage Summary Reports reader (with no user details) 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/activity-reports/activity-reports?view=o365-worldwide

Between the two, the Usage Summary Reports Reader role has fewer privileges as it is limited to viewing only tenant-level aggregates in specific reports1.
